game.title: Robotron: 2084
game.gameDescription: A fast-paced, twin-stick arcade shooter where the player must survive endless waves of hostile robots while rescuing the last remaining humans.

vision.description: Deliver an intense, chaotic, reflex-driven arcade experience that constantly pressures the player.
vision.designGoals: Immediate responsiveness, overwhelming enemy density, simple rules with extreme challenge.
vision.playerFantasy: A lone superhuman defender fighting against a machine apocalypse.
vision.targetExperience: Adrenaline-fueled panic, mastery through skill, and sensory overload.
vision.successMetrics: High replay frequency, short sessions, score-chasing behavior.

targetAudience.description: Players seeking challenging, skill-based arcade gameplay.
targetAudience.skillLevel: Easy to learn, extremely difficult to master.

platformConstraints.description: Designed for early 1980s arcade hardware with limited memory and processing power.

setting.description: A dystopian future where intelligent machines have turned on humanity.
setting.settingDescription: Robots have exterminated nearly all humans; the player fights to save the survivors.

narrative.description: Minimalist narrative used primarily as thematic framing.
narrative.narrativePremise: Evil robots seek to destroy the last humans.
narrative.conflict: Human survival versus rogue artificial intelligence.
narrative.storytellingMethod: Gameplay-driven with brief text and visual cues.
narrative.endingPhilosophy: No true ending; play continues until inevitable defeat.

player.description: A highly mobile, fragile character optimized for rapid movement and firing.
player.movement: Instant, omnidirectional movement with no inertia.
player.shooting: Independent directional shooting in eight directions.

controls.description: Twin-stick control scheme enabling independent movement and shooting.

systems.description: Core systems that drive moment-to-moment gameplay.

combatSystem.description: High-volume projectile combat against swarming enemies.
combatSystem.designIntentOfCombat: Overwhelm the player while rewarding precision and positioning.
combatSystem.damageModel: One-hit kill for both player and most enemies.

movementSystem.designIntent: Enable rapid evasion and fine positional control.

enemyAI.designIntentOfEnemyBehavior: Create constant pressure through numbers and varied movement patterns.

enemies.enemyBehavior: Indestructible enemy that chases the player.
Attempts to convert humans into enemies.

civilianCharacters.description: Non-combatant humans that must be rescued.

mechanics.coreLoop: Move → Shoot → Rescue humans → Survive escalating waves.

enemySpawning.description: Enemies spawn continuously around the arena.

difficulty.difficultyScalingModel: Enemy count, speed, and behavior density increase.

difficultyDesign.description: Designed to be brutally difficult with no safety nets.
difficultyDesign.playerCatchUpMechanics: Extra lives awarded via score thresholds.

ui.description: Minimalist arcade UI focused on clarity.

VisualAndAudioFeedback.description: Strong audiovisual cues for every action.
VisualAndAudioFeedback.audio: Distinctive electronic sound effects and constant background noise.

artDirection.visualStyle: Neon-colored vector-inspired sprites on a dark background.
artDirection.readabilityRules: Enemies and bullets must remain clearly visible amid chaos.

musicDesign.description: No traditional music; soundscape driven by effects.

audioDesign.soundDesignRules: Every action produces immediate audio feedback.

accessibility.description: Limited accessibility due to era of design.
accessibility.accessibilityRationale: Arcade design prioritized challenge and simplicity over customization.

gameFlow.gameFlowStates: Attract mode → Gameplay → Game over → High score entry.

technicalNotes.description: Designed around deterministic, high-performance arcade hardware.
technicalNotes.knownTechnicalRisks: Sprite overload and performance under extreme enemy counts.
